trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: The **WindowsFeature** resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to ensure that roles and features are added or removed on a target node.
trans-unit.target: The **WindowsFeature** resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to ensure that roles and features are added or removed on a target node.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the name of the role or feature that you want to ensure is added or removed.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the name of the role or feature that you want to ensure is added or removed.

trans-unit.source: This is the same as the __Name__ property from the [Get-WindowsFeature](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj205469.aspx) cmdlet, and not the display name of the role or feature.
trans-unit.target: This is the same as the __Name__ property from the [Get-WindowsFeature](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj205469.aspx) cmdlet, and not the display name of the role or feature.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the credentials to use to add or remove the role or feature.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the credentials to use to add or remove the role or feature.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the role or feature is added.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the role or feature is added.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that the role or feature is added, set this property to "Present" To ensure that the role or feature is removed, set the property to "Absent".
trans-unit.target: To ensure that the role or feature is added, set this property to "Present" To ensure that the role or feature is removed, set the property to "Absent".

trans-unit.source: Set this property to __$true__ to ensure the state of all required subfeatures with the state of the feature you specify with the __Name__ property.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to __$true__ to ensure the state of all required subfeatures with the state of the feature you specify with the __Name__ property.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the path to a log file where you want the resource provider to log the operation.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the path to a log file where you want the resource provider to log the operation.

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is __ResourceName__ and its type is __ResourceType__, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is __ResourceName__ and its type is __ResourceType__, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the location of the source file to use for installation, if necessary.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the location of the source file to use for installation, if necessary.
